name: New Views of the Landscape Exhibition
description:
Grounded in observation, uncover paintings by Jeffrey Malcolm celebrating the Canadian landscape through a contemporary lens. Each work creates new light, distance, and tone reimagining present-day approaches to colour and form and reshaping familiar terrain.

About the Artist
Jeffrey Malcolm is a Toronto-based artist whose work examines the Canadian landscape through a contemporary approach to colour, light, and technique. His paintings explore how observation and process uplift familiar subjects, strengthening the visual experience for a refreshed current perspective.

name: Keimara: A Solo Exhibition
description:
Step into a world of colour and creativity. 

Meet the artist and explore vibrant, playful originals from 2022–2026, inspired by love, spirituality, and inner worlds. All originals, prints, stickers, and other creations will be available for purchase.

Join Keimara for a hands-on session creating split self-portraits (abstract or figurative) exploring how you see yourself and how you feel seen by others. All materials provided, no experience needed.

Loohoo is a playful, creative concept shop in Parkdale, hosting markets, workshops, concerts, and other events celebrating local artists.

name: Sky & Bone presents Beading Workshops with Jenna Bjornson
description:
Join us for a hands-on beading workshop with Métis artist Jenna Bjornson, an artist grounded in storytelling and community. In this welcoming, beginner-friendly session, participants will create a 5-panel beaded flower pin backed with deer hide. All materials are provided.

 Jenna is Red River Métis with family ties to Fort Carlton, Saskatchewan. Jenna is a descendant of John Peter Pruden, a Chief Factor of the Hudson's Bay Company. Her beadwork focuses on traditional Métis designs with contemporary Indigenous designs, and on advocacy and awareness for Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Residential School Survivors. 

 Jenna works to ensure that Indigenous culture, practices, and stories are authentically told and presented. She has participated in many events such as the Native Child and Family Services Powwow and the Native Canadian Centre Holiday Market. She's currently the Operations Manager at the imagineNATIVE Film + Media Arts Festival.
